responses.issue: retroactive reduction of Korean car tariffs
responses.clarification: U.S. will reduce Korean car tariffs to 15% retroactively from November 1, 2025

confirmed_facts: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Ruttan confirmed that Korean car tariffs will be reduced to 15% retroactively from November 1, 2025.
The tariff reduction is part of the U.S.â€“Korea trade agreement following the MOU signed on December 14, 2025.

timeline.event: U.S. and Korea sign the Strategic Investment Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) that includes a provision for retroactive tariff reduction.
Korean National Assembly introduces the Special Law for Strategic Investment with the U.S.
Howard Ruttan publicly confirms the 15% retroactive tariff reduction.
Effective date of the retroactive tariff reduction.
